etymology.description: 人(人) (rén, "person") upright + 人(人) (rén, "person") upside down (𠤎) = reversal; change -> 化(化) (huà, "transform")
etymology.interpretation: 𠤎 is an ancient form of 化(化) (huà, "transform"), depicting two 人(人) (rén, "person"), one upright and one inverted, symbolizing change or transformation.

examples.chinese: 𠤎是一位仁爱的人(𠤎是一位仁愛的人)。
examples.pinyin: Rén shì yī wèi rén ài de rén.
examples.english: The person is a kind-hearted individual.

examples.chinese: 这个𠤎勤劳勇敢(這個𠤎勤勞勇敢)，追寻梦想(追尋夢想)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège rén qínláo yǒnggǎn, zhuīxún mèngxiǎng.
examples.english: This person is hardworking and brave, pursuing dreams.

examples.chinese: 那位𠤎博览群书(那位𠤎博覽羣書)，怀抱梦想(懷抱夢想)。
examples.pinyin: Nà wèi rén bó lǎn qún shū, huái bào mèngxiǎng.
examples.english: That person has read extensively and cherishes dreams.
